bits.name: combineTicks
bits.description: Use combined rear wheel-ticks instead of the single tick

bits.name: useWtSpeed
bits.description: Use speed measurements (data type 11 in ESF-MEAS) instead of single ticks (data type 10)

bits.name: dirPinPol
bits.description: Direction pin polarity. 0: High signal level means forward direction, 1: High signal level means backward direction.

bits.name: useWtPin
bits.description: Use wheel-tick pin for speed measurement.

bits.name: autoWtCountMaxOff
bits.description: Disable automatic estimation of maximum absolute wheel-tick counter value

bits.name: autoDirPinPolOff
bits.description: Disable automatic wheel-tick direction pin polarity detection

bits.name: autoSoftwareWtOff
bits.description: Disable automatic use of wheel-tick or speed data received over the software interface if available

bits.name: autoUseWtSpeedOff
bits.description: Disable automatic receiver reconfiguration for processing speed data instead of wheel-tick data

fields.name: wtFactor
fields.description: Wheel-tick scale factor to obtain distance [m] from wheel-ticks

fields.name: wtQuantError
fields.description: Wheel-tick quantization. If useWtSpeed is set then this is interpreted as the speed measurement error RMS.

fields.name: wtLatency
fields.description: Wheel-tick data latency due to e.g. CAN bus

fields.name: wtFrequency
fields.description: Nominal wheel-tick data frequency (0 = not set)

bits.name: cntBothEdges
bits.description: Count both rising and falling edges on wheel-tick signal

fields.name: speedDeadBand
fields.description: Speed sensor dead band (0 = not set)

adjudication.reasoning: The provided extraction is accurate and matches the standard u-blox M8 Automotive Dead Reckoning (ADR) protocol documentation. The message structure correctly calculates to a 32-byte payload, and all bitfield assignments and scale factors (1e-6) are correctly identified.
